Notes: Longbow radar-equipped for target acquisition (up to 8 km air detection); carries 4 AIM-92 Stinger air-to-air missiles for helicopter-vs-helicopter BVR-lite defense; supports JASDF cueing via tactical datalinks; 13 built by Fuji, 1 lost in 2018 crash; upgrades focus on Hellfire/Stinger integration for contested airspace.

Advanced scout with millimeter-wave radar (10+ km detection) and 4 Type 91 AAMs for short-range air-to-air intercepts; provides forward targeting for BVR missile updates to JASDF F-35s/F-15s; successor to OH-6D, with avionics upgrades in 2025 for drone integration.

Legacy TOW/Hydra-armed platform with limited air-to-air via TOW variants; escorts convoys and cues ground radars for BVR support; built by Fuji, fleet retiring progressively (target 50 by 2026) in favor of AH-64/OH-1; still operational for surge in hybrid ops.

Fixed-wing ISR with electro-optical sensors (50+ km slant-range detection) for battlefield surveillance; feeds data to JASDF AEW via secure links to enable long-range targeting; sole fixed-wing asset, upgraded in 2024 for ELINT roles in Pacific theater.

Multi-role with potential for door-mounted Stinger launchers; inserts scout teams/UAVs for BVR cueing; built by Mitsubishi, 40 acquired but 1 lost in 2023 Miyako-jima crash; 2025 upgrades add crashworthy fuel tanks for forward deployment.

Dual-rotor lifter for rapid deployment of attack/scout helos and radar units to support BVR envelopes; built by Kawasaki, with 12 more JA variants on order; enhanced ECM suite in 2025 for survivability in contested zones.

Small rotary-wing UAV for tactical ISR (5 km range, real-time video); deploys ahead of forces to spot air threats and cue BVR missiles; indigenous system, integrated with OH-1/AH-64 for low-altitude targeting.

Persistent fixed-wing loiterer (up to 24 hours, 100+ km range) for wide-area surveillance; launches from trucks to provide off-board cues for JASDF BVR engagements; procured in 2011, operational with Central Readiness Force for hazard recon.
